titleStmt.title: An examination of those plausible appearances which seeme most to commend the Romish Church, and to preiudice the reformed Discovering them to be but meere shifts, purposely invented, to hinder an exact triall of doctrine by the Scriptures. By Mr Iohn Cameron. Englished out of French.
Traicté auquel sont examinez les prejugez de ceux de l'église romaine contre la religion reformée. English
titleStmt.author: Cameron, John, 1579?-1625.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A17864 of text S107409 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 4531). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

titleStmt.title: An examination of those plausible appearances which seeme most to commend the Romish Church, and to preiudice the reformed Discovering them to be but meere shifts, purposely invented, to hinder an exact triall of doctrine by the Scriptures. By Mr Iohn Cameron. Englished out of French.
Traicté auquel sont examinez les prejugez de ceux de l'église romaine contre la religion reformée. English
titleStmt.author: Cameron, John, 1579?-1625.
Pinke, William, 1599?-1629.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Iohn Lichfield and William Turner, for Edward Forrest,

notesStmt.note: A translation by William Pinke of: Traicté: auquel sont examinez les prejugez de ceux de l'Église romaine contre la religion reformée.
Running title reads: Popish preiudices against the reformed rel. examined and confuted.

This state lacks the two-leaf dedication to the Company of Skinners. The preliminaries are in two settings: (1) Two leaves unsigned; title page has a square block of four type ornaments; line 4 of "To the reader" ends "book"; no contents leaves. (2) Four leaves signed *; title page has a rectangular block of eight type ornaments; line 4 of "To the reader" ends "booke"; contents leaves have chapter 16 with "direction is which".
Identified as STC 4531a on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.

keywords.term: Catholic Church -- Controversial literature -- Early works to 1800.
